result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D. Tveten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with L.G., family or residence in Elderon WI.

Counseling
May transfer jail and probation to Winnebago County.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I&S for rule violations. Eligible for huber for work, school, or treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Amended

Case called: 2:24pm. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears by Atty Hank Schultz. Atty Schultz states agreement for Court to DRI Waupaca Cty Case and provides email to the Crt. Crt questions Atty Schultz re: consent from DA re: DRI case. Atty Schultz makes statement.  State moves for leave of court to file Amended Information - crt grants. State moves to amend ct 1 (theft) to 1 ct of receiving stolen property (943.23(1)(a) - crt grants. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI Waupaca Cty Case #14CM45- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - amend ct 1 (receive stolen property). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Atty Schultz makes statement. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 1 yr probation. CONDITIONS: Impose & Stay 30 days MCJ for rule violations; eligible for work, school or treatment; may transfer to Winnebago Cty; Restitution $500.00 to L.G.; Counseling; DNA Surcharge; Court Costs; No contact with L.G.; family or residence in Elderon, WI. May transfer probation to Winnebago. Adjourned: 2:33pm.
Plea hearing on November 5, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Plea hearing on November 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Final pre-trial on October 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  No contact with victim(s):  L.G.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
